title: Analyzing Historical Decisions
description: Write an analytical essay about a historical crisis and explore alternative outcomes using the third conditional.

prompt.topic: Learning from History: What Could Have Been Different?
prompt.scenario: Choose a significant historical event or crisis (e.g., environmental disaster, humanitarian crisis, economic collapse, or conflict). Analyze what happened and discuss what might have been different if key decisions had been made differently.
requirements: Briefly describe the historical event or crisis you have chosen
Use the third conditional to discuss at least three alternative scenarios
Analyze the potential outcomes of different decisions
Include your perspective on what lessons can be learned
Use appropriate vocabulary for discussing global issues and causation

introduction: One of the most significant [crises/events] of recent history was...
Looking back at [event], we can identify several critical moments when different decisions might have changed everything.
The [crisis] of [year] serves as a powerful reminder of how important timely action can be.
bodyParagraphs: If [leader/organization] had [action], [result] would have been different.
The situation could have been prevented if...
Had [action] been taken earlier, [outcome] might have been avoided.
Looking at the evidence, if [condition], then [result] would not have occurred.
conclusion: The lessons from this event are clear: if we had..., we would have...
Moving forward, we must learn that early intervention and international cooperation are essential.

usefulExpressions.example: If stricter regulations had been implemented, the disaster could have been prevented.
Thousands of deaths would have been avoided if aid had arrived sooner.
Had the warning signs been recognized, authorities could have evacuated the area.
The conflict might never have occurred if diplomatic solutions had been prioritized.
If only governments had cooperated earlier, the crisis would not have escalated.

criteria: Clear description of the historical event
At least three third conditional scenarios explored
Correct use of third conditional structure
Appropriate use of modal verbs (would/could/might have)

sampleAnswer.text:
The 2010 Haiti earthquake remains one of the deadliest natural disasters in modern history, claiming over 200,000 lives. While no one could have prevented the earthquake itself, the devastating death toll could have been significantly reduced if different decisions had been made.

First, if building codes had been properly enforced in Port-au-Prince, many structures would not have collapsed so catastrophically. The city's rapid growth had outpaced safety regulations, and thousands died in poorly constructed buildings that could have been built to withstand seismic activity.

Second, the international response, though substantial, arrived too late for many victims. If emergency response systems had been better coordinated before the disaster, rescue teams could have saved more lives in the critical first 72 hours. Had pre-positioned supplies been available in the region, immediate relief would have reached survivors faster.

Finally, if long-term development investment had strengthened local infrastructure and healthcare systems, the country would have been more resilient. Economic inequality had left Haiti vulnerable, and poverty magnified every aspect of the tragedy.

These scenarios teach us that disaster preparedness is not optional. If we had learned these lessons earlier, future tragedies might be prevented or minimized. The cost of prevention is always lower than the cost of recovery.

annotations.text: if building codes had been properly enforced
If emergency response systems had been better coordinated
if long-term development investment had strengthened
annotations.comment: Third conditional with complex noun phrase
Mixed conditional: past condition, future result

selfCheckList: Did I clearly describe the historical event or crisis?
Did I use at least three third conditional sentences correctly?
Did I analyze potential alternative outcomes?
Did I include both 'if' clauses and result clauses?
Did I use varied modal verbs (would/could/might have)?
Did I include vocabulary related to global issues?
Did I organize my essay with clear paragraphs?
Did I include a meaningful conclusion with lessons learned?
Is my essay within the word count (180-250 words)?
